verses.verse: To the chief<WH5329> Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm<WH4210> of David.<WH1732> How<WH5704> long<WH5704> will you forget<WH7911> me, O LORD?<WH3068> for ever?<WH5331> how<WH5704> long<WH5704> will you hide<WH5641> your face<WH6440> from me?

How<WH5704> long<WH5704> shall I take<WH7896> counsel<WH6098> in my soul,<WH5315> having sorrow<WH3015> in my heart<WH3824> daily?<WH3119> how<WH5704> long<WH5704> shall my enemy<WH341> be exalted<WH7311> over<WH5921> me?
Consider<WH5027> and hear<WH6030> me, O LORD<WH3068> my God:<WH430> lighten<WH215> my eyes,<WH5869> lest<WH6435> I sleep<WH3462> the sleep of death;<WH4194>
Lest<WH6435> my enemy<WH341> say,<WH559> I have prevailed<WH3201> against him; and those that trouble<WH6862> me rejoice<WH1523> when<WH3588> I am moved.<WH4131>
But I have trusted<WH982> in your mercy;<WH2617> my heart<WH3820> shall rejoice<WH1523> in your salvation.<WH3444>
I will sing<WH7891> to the LORD,<WH3068> because<WH3588> he has dealt<WH1580> bountifully<WH1580> with me.
